channel.title: A Question Regarding .EXE's And SCAR
channel.description:
I have a question about SCAR, is it possible to turn a script into a .EXE file so everyone can use it? Even those who do not have SCAR.
If it isn't, then is there a program or something that could turn the SCAR code into a different kind of code? Probably not, but I figured I'd ask. So far I only know how to code SCAR and I don't want to learn another programming language right now.
Thanks.

item.title: A Question Regarding .EXE's And SCAR
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

The Un-Named:

Kylix is pretty much Delphi for Linux.

But you’re chained completely to Borland’s VCL and object library if you wish to be able to compile in Kylix as well as Delphi. This is only a problem if you’re making an advanced application, which will most likely need to use OS-specific features.

dooponbench:

But on my mac, it just says it just says cant find the application. How can I fix that?

Huh? Off topic…

Read full topic

Kylix is pretty much Delphi for Linux.

item.title: A Question Regarding .EXE's And SCAR
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Raidivion, post:10, topic:120557”]Yeah VB.net ownz ffs.
Its not as good as C++, Java or Delphi yeah but its awesome!
I did a lot of neat work with it.
If you don’t want to go for VB.net try C#. Its better then Delphi and Java and its quite easy I’ve heard.[/quote]

The problem with C# and VB.net is they both parts .NET.

Now, the problem with .NET is simply that it’s made by Microsoft. .NET was made for multiple languages mainly for Windows machines, however Sun’s JVM and Java were made for 1 language on every machine, this wins me over right here, but for a bit of overkill, more languages can be added to the JVM, as .NET SLOWLY ports to other operating systems. The most recent versions AREN’T available.

If your going to learn something, go for Java, or if you prefer RAD(Rapid Application Development(this includes VB and Delphi)) tools, seriously go for Delphi, because you can use Kylix to compile your application for Linux.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:5, topic:120557”]If you want to master something, don’t go for VB, go for Java because once you learn that, you can compile a program that will run on every operating system. Windows, Mac, Linux, etc.

If you don’t want to do java, then still don’t try VB. Try Delphi which is pretty similar to scar or try C which gives you so much control over your application, it’s scary.[/quote]

What’s wrong with VB? Is it not as flexible as Java or C?

Read full topic

@Ron wrote:

If you want to master something, don’t go for VB, go for Java because once you learn that, you can compile a program that will run on every operating system. Windows, Mac, Linux, etc.

If you don’t want to do java, then still don’t try VB. Try Delphi which is pretty similar to scar or try C which gives you so much control over your application, it’s scary.

item.title: A Question Regarding .EXE's And SCAR
item.dc:creator: @Dregen Dregen
item.description:
@Dregen wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:2, topic:120557”]You could because SCAR’s language is not very different from Delphi, but if you used any SRL functions, then you would have a problem.

If you have some kind of Delphi compiler, and you get cruel’s include (www.cruels.net), then you can make the exe file, because cruel’s include is said to be similar to SRL. It will be a lot of work. Good luck if you are going to try it.

Other than that, I don’t think there is a way.[/quote]

I wasn’t planning to use SRL functions, wasn’t even planning to use it as a macro, just a calculator. I don’t know much about scripting SCAR but it would be pretty easy to make a calculator.

But I don’t know anything about Delphi, I’m not really a master coder or anything like that. I think I’ll just learn Visual Basic (VB .Net 2003) because my dad has a book from college on it and it looks simple enough so far. I hope most of the coding is similar because I haven’t read any parts about coding yet, just making a UI/GUI.

Thanks anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: A Question Regarding .EXE's And SCAR
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

You could because SCAR’s language is not very different from Delphi, but if you used any SRL functions, then you would have a problem.

If you have some kind of Delphi compiler, and you get cruel’s include (www.cruels.net), then you can make the exe file, because cruel’s include is said to be similar to SRL. It will be a lot of work. Good luck if you are going to try it.

Other than that, I don’t think there is a way.

Read full topic
